name: bicomdd
params: wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3

stmt.origin: syl6ib(w0, w1, wb(w2, w3), wb(w3, w2))

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wi(w1, wb(w2, w3)))
-| wi(w0, wi(w1, wb(w3, w2)))
-| wb(wb(w3, w2), wb(w2, w3))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wi(w1, wb(w2, w3)))
-| wi(w0, wi(w1, wb(w3, w2)))
-| wb(wb(w3, w2), wb(w2, w3))

|- wi(w0, wi(w1, wb(w2, w3)))
-| wi(w0, wi(w1, wb(w3, w2)))

comment: Commute two sides of a biconditional in a deduction. (Contributed by Rodolfo Medina, 19-Oct-2010.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 29-Jun-2011.)
